actual_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: Name
PARENT: ParentClass
GRAPH: GraphName

Rules:

raw_output:
Rules:
- Node IDs use n1, n2, n3... numbering
- EXEC lines = white execution wires
- DATA lines = colored data wires, always include [Type]
- Every exec chain must start from an Event node
- Only use node types and pin names from the reference below

Node Reference — ALWAYS USE EXACT NAMES FROM THIS LIST

Node Types:
Actor — Destroys the actor
Audio — Plays a sound effect
Branch — If/else conditional branch
Event — Blueprint event node
FlipFlop — Alternates between two execution paths
Gate — Passes or blocks execution flow
Math — Performs a mathematical operation
SetBool — Sets a Boolean variable to true or false
ToggleBool — Inverts a Boolean variable

Node Rules — RULES FOR EACH NODE TYPE

Valid rules for Actor nodes:
IN: Execute:exec
OUT: Then:exec

Valid rules for Audio nodes:
IN: Play, Stop
OUT: Completed:exec

Valid rules for Branch nodes:
IN: Execute:exec
OUT: True:exec, False:exec

Valid rules for Event nodes:
IN: n/a
OUT: Enter:exec, Exit:exec, Activate:exec, Deactivate:exec, Tick:exec

Valid rules for FlipFlop nodes:
IN: Enter:exec, Reset:exec
OUT: A:exec, B:exec, IsA:Bool, IsB:Bool

Valid rules for Gate nodes:
IN: Open, Close, Toggle
OUT: Enter:exec, Exit:exec, bPassed:Bool

Valid rules for Math nodes:
IN: A:Float, B:Float
OUT: Add:Float, Sub:Float, Mul:Float, Div:Float

Valid rules for SetBool nodes:
IN: Set
OUT: Bool:Bool

Valid rules for ToggleBool nodes:
IN: Toggle
OUT: Bool:Bool

Pin Data Types — ALWAYS USE TYPES FROM THIS LIST

Bool — Boolean value
Byte — 8-bit integer
Float — Floating-point number
Int — 32-bit integer
String — Text string
Vector — 2D vector

BLUEPRINT: Name
PARENT: ParentClass

NODE ID: NodeType [Property=Value]
EXEC NodeID.Pin -> NodeID.Pin
DATA NodeID.Pin -> NodeID.Pin [Type]

PARENT: Actor

NODE n2: CastToCharacter

  IN: Execute:exec
  OUT: Then:exec

  IN: Execute:exec
  OUT: Then:exec

  IN: Execute:exec
  OUT: Then:exec

Node: Event_ActorEndOverlap — Fires when an overlapping actor stops overlapping
  IN: Execute:exec
  OUT: Then:exec

Node: ActionBranch — If/else conditional branch
  IN: Execute:exec, Condition:Bool
  OUT: True:exec, False:exec

Node: ActionFlipFlop — Alternates between two execution paths
  IN: Execute:exec
  OUT: A:exec, B:exec, IsA:Bool

Node: ActionDoOnce — Executes only the first time, blocks subsequent calls
  IN: Execute:exec, Reset:exec
  OUT: Completed:exec, RemainingAttempts:Int

Node: ActionDelay — Pauses execution for a specified duration
  IN: Execute:exec, Duration:Float
  OUT: Completed:exec

Node: ActionForEachLoop — Iterates over each element in an array
  IN: Execute:exec, Array:Array
  OUT: LoopBody:exec, ArrayElement:Object, ArrayIndex:Int, Completed:exec

Node: ActionGate — Passes or blocks execution flow based on open/close state
  IN: Enter:exec, Open:exec, Close:exec, Toggle:exec
  OUT: Exit:exec

Node: AudioPlaySound — Plays a sound effect
  IN: Execute:exec, Sound:Object
  OUT: Then:exec

Node: AudioStopSound — Stops a sound effect
  IN: Execute:exec
  OUT: Then:exec

Node: CastingCastToCharacter — Attempts to cast an object to the Character class
  IN: Execute:exec, Object:Object
  OUT: CastSucceeded:exec,

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on Tick, gets the distance to another actor stored in a variable called TargetActor. If the distance is less than 500, print Close.
expected_dsl:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DistanceChecker
PARENT: Actor

VAR TargetActor: Actor = None

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetDistanceTo
NODE n3: LessThanFloat
NODE n4: Branch
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Close"]

EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.True -> n5.Execute

DATA n1.TargetActor -> n2.OtherActor [Actor]
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Condition [Bool]
actual_dsl:
Rules:
- Node IDs use n1, n2, n3... numbering
- EXEC lines = white execution wires
- DATA lines = colored data wires, always lower case [Type]
- Every exec chain must start from an Event node
- Only use node types and pin names from the reference below

Node reference — ALWAYS USE EXACT NAME AND PIN NAMES:

Actor — Valid parent class for Blueprint DSL

Node: Event_BeginPlay — Executes when the game starts or the actor is spawned
  OUT: Execlinedata — Always white

Node: Event_Tick — Executes every frame
  OUT: Execlinedata — Always white

Node: Event_ActorBeginOverlap — Executes when another actor overlaps this actor
  OUT: Execlinedata — Always white

Node: Event_ActorEndOverlap — Executes when an overlapping actor stops overlapping
  OUT: Execlinedata — Always white

Node: Action_Print — Prints a string to the screen
  IN: Execute — Always white
  OUT: Then — Always white
  DATA IN: bIsBlueprintDSLFormat — Always blue, MUST BE TRUE

Node: Action Branch — If/else conditional branch
  IN: Execute — Always white
  OUT: True, False — Always white
  DATA IN: Condition — Always purple

Node: Action FlipFlop — Alternates between two execution paths
  IN: Execute — Always white
  OUT: A, B — Always white
  DATA IN: bReset — Always blue

Node: Action DoOnce — Executes only the first time, blocks subsequent calls
  IN: Execute — Always white
  OUT: Completed — Always white
  DATA IN: Reset — Always blue

Node: Action Delay — Pauses execution for a specified duration
  IN: Execute — Always white
  OUT: Completed — Always white
  DATA IN: Duration — Always gray

Node: ActionForEachLoop — Iterates over each element in an array
  IN: Execute — Always white
  OUT: LoopBody, LoopCompleted — Always white
  DATA IN: Array — Always green

Node: Action Gate — Passes or blocks execution flow based on open/close state
  IN: Enter — Always white
  OUT: Exit — Always white
  DATA IN: Open, Close, Toggle — Always red

Node: Actor_SetVisibility — Sets visibility of the actor
  IN: Execute — Always white
  OUT: Then — Always white
  DATA IN: bNewVisibility —
